text: Surface Splat
Builds a mask of surface-distance splats on geometry from strokes.

Surface Splat is an internal tool used for efficiently computing the
surface-distance splats from stroke primitives.  The canonical use
is in the Attribute Paint SOP where it applies the surface brush.
The point attribute to write the splat values to.
Mask Output

The default is 0 for un-splatted and 1 for fully splatted.  Complementing
    the mask inverts this, so 1 is un-splatted and 0 is fully splatted,
    as used in the Attribute Paint SOP.
Complement Mask
Mask Generation

The second input contains primitives storing attributes on the primitive
and points to describe how to splat.

Point attribute storing the diameter of each splat.  This is measured
    along the surface of the geometry, so will respect curvature and
    disconnected components.
Width
Point attribute storing the opacity of each splat.

will splat
    fully at the center of the point,
will not splat at all.
Alpha

Primitive attribute storing the amount of feathering around each
    splat.

will transition directly from fully splatted to un-splatted
    at the splat width.

will have a solid core of 50% of the
    width and then transition smoothly to un-splatted.

will have
    a smooth transition from the center to the edge.
Soft Edge
Point attribute storing if the point should be processed.  If
the point will be ignored.
Hit

Point attribute storing which primitive the splat should originate
    on.  The primitive number is the primitive in the first input.
    If it is invalid, the splat will be ignored.
Hit Prim

Point attribute storing the location in the primitive the splat
    should originate.  This is a bary-centric coordinate in the 
    primitive, so is not related to texture coordinates.
